items.title: What Are the Effects of a Government Shutdown?
items.summary: Ben Casselman, the chief economics correspondent for The New York Times, describes the economic effects of a government shutdown.

items.title: A More Polarized Senate Drives Shutdown Gridlock
items.summary: With few senators from conservative states in their ranks, Democrats feel less pressure to capitulate, while more conservative Republicans are not inclined to cut a deal.

items.title: Full Federal Appeals Court to Hear Alien Enemies Act Case
items.summary: The decision vacated a finding by a panel of the court’s judges regarding President Trump’s use of the Alien Enemies Act to deport immigrants, but did not clear the way for such expulsions to resume.

items.title: Judge Disqualifies Nevada’s Acting U.S. Attorney From Handling Cases
items.summary: A federal judge said Sigal Chattah was not “validly serving as acting U.S. attorney.” The Trump administration had appointed her to the post in a way that circumvented federal procedures.

items.title: Judge Blocks Trump Move to Cut FEMA Funds Over Immigration Policy
items.summary: A coalition of blue states and Washington, D.C., accused the Trump administration of illegally “taking money from its enemies” in freezing emergency preparedness grants.

items.title: Are You Quitting the Military? We Want to Hear From You.
items.summary: The New York Times is looking for generals and admirals who are quitting the military following an address from the defense secretary.

items.title: US government shutdown live: first closure since 2018 begins after funding bill fails
items.summary: <p>Competing bills rejected in Senate as Republicans and Democrats accuse each other of partisan politics. Follow the latest news and updates after the US government shut down</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/01/us-government-shuts-down">US government shuts down after Democrats refuse to back Republican funding plan</a></p></li></ul><p><strong>The US government is hurtling towards its first shutdown in six years, with no signs <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/us-congress">congressional</a> leaders are near agreement on legislation to continue funding beyond the Tuesday night deadline to prevent workers from being furloughed and agencies from shutting their doors.</strong></p><p>Congress’s <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/republicans">Republican</a> majority is pushing legislation to fund the government through 21 November, but Democrats have refused to vote for it unless it includes a series of concessions centered on healthcare.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/sep/30/us-government-shutdown-funding-trump-vance-portland-hegseth-latest-updates">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: What does a government shutdown mean and why is this year’s threat more serious?
items.summary: <p>The US government has shut down because Congress couldn’t reach a funding agreement. Here’s what to know about what happens next</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/sep/30/us-government-shutdown-funding-trump-vance-portland-hegseth-latest-updates">US government shutdown – live updates</a></p></li></ul><p>Much of the federal government officially began to shut down on Wednesday, after <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/us-congress">Congress</a> failed to reach a funding agreement before the midnight deadline. The shutdown will have a wide range of effects on government services and potentially the US economy.</p><p>Republicans put forward a stopgap measure to keep agencies open through 21 November, but Democrats have withheld their support, demanding the bill address <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/30/government-shutdown-healthcare-medicaid">recent Medicaid cuts and extend health insurance subsidies</a> under the Affordable Care Act scheduled to expire at the end of the year. Republican leaders dismissed their demands as a non-starter and united to block Democrats’s short-term funding proposal.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/27/government-shutdown-explainer">Continue reading...</a>
